info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Berks County through 430 PM EDT... At 400 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Friedensburg, or near Schuylkill Haven, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Reading, Wyomissing, Hamburg, Fleetwood, Sinking Spring, Laureldale, Wernersville, Robesonia, Leesport, Shoemakersville, Bernville, Strausstown, Fairview Hgts, Spring Ridge, Centerport, Whitfield, West Lawn, Wyomissing Hills and West Wyomissing. This includes Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 16 and 31. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
